text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm and today we are doing something
called mustard glazed salmon man that
sounds boring and it kind of is but it
is incredibly delicious and it's hard to
call something that has like two
ingredients or recipe but i'm going to
so here's the recipe we're take a couple
teaspoons of rice vinegar and we're
gonna take about a tablespoon and a half
of hot dijon mustard or Dijon mustard
most dijon mustard has a little bit of
kick to it alright don't use it if you
use that yellow stuff you know I've used
this joke before but stop stop watching
my site alright you're gonna mix that
together with the vinegar now that is
the original recipe that I learned at
the infamous carnelian room in San
Francisco now what I do is spiced up a
little bit I'm gonna put a few drops of
shirato
I never say that right sriracha it's an
Asian hot sauce and just a pinch of salt
I were to give that a nice stir with a
spoon and that's it this is a really
really delicious glaze for salmon and
you know the deal with salmon we've
talked about it before it's so boring we
got to eat it so healthy but we run out
of things to do with it so pre-heat your
broiler this is gonna be just such a
fast and easy dish put some foil on a
baking sheet a couple drips of oil those
are a couple of five ounce fillets and
then evenly distribute or distribute if
you prefer your rice vinegar and Dijon
mustard glaze so once it's coated it
goes in the broiler for about five to
eight minutes you know depends on how
thick it is blah blah blah so mine went
about 6 minutes the top was just
beautifully glazed the inside still
moist and medium and it's just kind of a
sweet and sour a little bit spicy I got
all artistic there with some dots of the
hot sauce to strata a little bit of slaw
and man that was a delicious dinner so
anyway go to the site get the
ingredients there's like two of them
and as always enjoy
